page.title: 05SCHOOL
page.content: The school serves the villages of Ducis and Kingston, and is now called the Collingbourne C.E. Primary School.In 1978 the school in Kingston was closed as the number of children on the roll had fallen, and extra classrooms were provided in Ducis to cater for the greater numbers. At the moment there are 99 children on the roll, and they are divided into four classes. Three of these are held in mobile rooms and one in the original building. The headteacher is Mr. G Evans and there are three fulltime assistants and a part-time teacher as well.Most of the children stay in school at midday; of these about thirty have school lunches which come in containers from Castledown School. The other children bring sandwiches.
